formulas.raw: Greatest common divisor (GCD) extraction: Let P(x) have integer coefficients. If g = gcd of all coefficients, then $$P(x) = g \cdot Q(x)$$ where Q(x) has coprime integer coefficients. Difference of squares: $$a^2 - b^2 = (a - b)(a + b)$$ Sum/difference of cubes: $$a^3 + b^3 = (a + b)\left(a^2 - ab + b^2\right)$$ $$a^3 - b^3 = (a - b)\left(a^2 + ab + b^2\right)$$ Quadratic factorization via discriminant: For \(ax^2 + bx + c\), if \(D = b^2 - 4ac\) is a perfect square then $$ax^2 + bx + c = a\left(x - \frac{-b + \sqrt{D}}{2a}\right)\left(x - \frac{-b - \sqrt{D}}{2a}\right).$$ Rational Root Theorem: If \(P(x)\) has integer coefficients and a rational root \(r = \frac{p}{q}\) in lowest terms, then \(p\) divides the constant term and \(q\) divides the leading coefficient. Dividing by \((q x - p)\) reduces the degree.
